intro: Gypsophila corymbosa, commonly known as the sweet pea flower or garden gypsophila, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, fluffy blooms that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces numerous small, clustered flowers on slender stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden borders and cut flower arrangements. Gypsophila corymbosa is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
